verses.text_plain: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.text_plain: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?
verses.verse_html:
2If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking? ▼
▼ to…: Heb. a word
 , ▼
▼ withhold…: Heb. refrain from words?

tokens.text: with thee, wilt thou be grieved

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. a word
▼ withhold…: Heb. refrain from words?

verses.text_plain: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
verses.verse_html: 3Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

verses.text_plain: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
verses.verse_html: 4Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

verses.text_plain: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
verses.verse_html: 5But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

verses.text_plain: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?
verses.verse_html: 6Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?

verses.text_plain: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?
verses.verse_html: 7Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?

verses.text_plain: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
verses.verse_html: 8Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

verses.text_plain: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.
verses.verse_html:
9By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed. ▼
▼ by the breath…: that is, by his anger

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by the breath…: that is, by his anger
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by the breath…: that is, by his anger

verses.text_plain: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
verses.verse_html: 10The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

verses.text_plain: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.
verses.verse_html: 11The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.

verses.text_plain: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.
verses.verse_html:
12Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof. ▼
▼ secretly: Heb. by stealth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ secretly: Heb. by stealth

verses.text_plain: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
verses.verse_html: 13In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,

verses.text_plain: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
verses.verse_html:
14Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake. ▼
▼ came…: Heb. met
 , ▼
▼ all: Heb. the multitude of

footnotes.body_html: ▼ all: Heb. the multitude of

verses.text_plain: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:
verses.verse_html: 15Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:

verses.text_plain: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,
verses.verse_html:
16It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying, ▼
▼ there…: or, I heard a still voice

footnotes.body_text: ▼ there…: or, I heard a still voice
footnotes.body_html: ▼ there…: or, I heard a still voice

verses.text_plain: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?
verses.verse_html: 17Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?

verses.text_plain: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:
verses.verse_html:
18Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly: ▼
▼ and his…: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light

footnotes.body_text: ▼ and his…: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light
footnotes.body_html: ▼ and his…: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light

verses.text_plain: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?
verses.verse_html: 19How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?

verses.text_plain: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.
verses.verse_html:
20They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it. ▼
▼ destroyed: Heb. beaten in pieces

footnotes.body_html: ▼ destroyed: Heb. beaten in pieces

verses.text_plain: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
verses.verse_html: 21Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
